text:
I noticed two packages `IntervalSets` and `Intervals` that do the same thing, and both have a similar number of transitive dependents: <https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages/IntervalSets/2FHuv/0.5.2> and <https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages/Intervals/ihXRn/1.5.0> . `IntervalSets` is used directly much more often, though.
Any suggestions which one to choose? And is anyone aware of why they are separate packages in the first place?

elements.text: that do the same thing, and both have a similar number of transitive dependents:

is used directly much more often, though.
Any suggestions which one to choose? And is anyone aware of why they are separate packages in the first place?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56824| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

Intervals.jl is maintained by Invenia, who primarily maintains LibPQ.jl and related packages (in my view.) As such, I would bet that Intervals.jl reflects the Postgresql concept of an interval (and perhaps interface), which may slightly differ from the mathematical concept of an interval.
